intro: Maxillaria caespitifica, commonly known as the clustered maxillaria, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compact, pseudobulbous structure and dense clusters of dark green, strap-like leaves. The plant produces fragrant, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, often with intricate patterns on the petals and sepals. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements make it a favored ornamental plant among orchid enthusiasts.
